text: baby baby baby baby baby baby
bbbbbb beep hi everyone Anthony Fantana
here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for a review of the new
Thundercat album apocalypse Thundercat
is a virtuoso bass player and a
songwriter from LA who went from
suicidal tendencies band member to
flagship artist on the brain feeder
Records label in the matter of a few
years through some really nice
contributions to the music of Flying
Lotus and a pretty well-received debut
full-length LP the Golden Age of
Apocalypse an album that did feature
production from Flying Lotus on it and
brought together his love of wonky and
just Spacey experimental electronics and
hip hop together with Thundercats love
of new jazz jazz fusion jazz funk some
of the songs were kinda brief and the
vocals were not the best but the album
still had incredible aura about it and
and was one of my favorite LPS the year
got dropped mostly because of the very
flashy bass lines and melody writing the
very progressive kind of futuristic
production however in my opinion I don't
feel that Apocalypse brings a lot of
what made the Golden Age of Apocalypse
so charming to begin with even though
Thundercat does take a lot of influence
from jazz and jazz fusion this record is
still pretty overwhelmingly electronic
and and that's fine I mean his last
record was electronic as well but that
really progressive futuristic
forward-thinking vibe of the sounds that
are going into Thundercats music seems
to have kind of disappeared and has left
some of the more upbeat songs on this
album feeling like mere demos of tracks
that would have definitely come out in
the era of music that Thundercat pulls
from influentially they just feel as if
I'm hearing sequence drums behind some
very vocal and bass and since mixing and
really what these songs are awaiting is
is a real studio recording with a full
live band songs like heartbeats and
setbacks as well as the track oh [ __ ]
it's X there
quite a few passable songs you know
verse chorus verse type songs on this
record and there are other tracks on
here that don't really feel like songs
at all songs that are more motif like
tracks that to me sound unengaging and
kind of uninspired in just about every
way that you could look at them like the
very dark bass line and the hissing
sounds on the track crack crack crack
crack the life aquatic attract the sets
a pretty ominous tone and really does
nothing with it for a very repetitive
two minutes I feel the same thing about
the track seven and then there are the
vocals which of course had never really
been Thundercats strongest point on his
records but he's easily overcome that
issue with very forward-thinking beats
and sounds and sound craft is great
playing and his melodies which a lot of
the time are very angular memorable kind
of sweet jazzy but on a lot of tracks
here his pitch is just is just barely
there or it's hanging on to the note
he's singing by a thread on top of it
his vocals on many tracks here are
touched with this reverb effect that is
very very thinning making his voice feel
even more weak than than it is when he
reaches up into his falsetto not only
that but Thundercats vocal delivery on
these tracks is pretty flatlined as well
to me it feels like I'm listening to a
really nervous performer at a vocal
recital
there are definitely flashes of
interesting moments on this record for
me songs like special stage which has a
very sweet pretty and contortionist
melody on it that just does backflips
all over the track even though it is
very slow and kind of a motive though
the lyrics are a little corny don't you
know you rock my world the synth
melodies that come through right at the
beginning on the track oh [ __ ] it's X I
mean they're really fun which is
something this album is incredibly
lacking in especially since a lot of the
grooves that the beats on this record
are supposed to be driving are so
corpse-like aside from ocean it's X many
of the songs on here are just stiff as
hell the track the
actually felt like it had live drumming
in the mix the grooves that the drum
were playing were very hard there was an
improv there against the bass it felt
like I was hearing some
live-in-the-moment
action on this particular track which
excited me in a sense because I've
caught Thundercat live before and him in
his band that he performs with are
amazing but the improvisations toward
the end of the track weren't really all
that memorable though they were really
chaotic and kind of noisy and the
recording on the drums on this track
just sounds like crap I mean it's just a
lot of noise and I can't really make out
a lot of the details and just a lot of
the finesse that was going into the
drumming on this song because it's just
really so rough around the edges and
thrown together so with the weak songs
on this album the boring melodies the
pretty cringe-worthy vocal performances
and the loss of just flavor and style
and direction on this album I was
incredibly disappointed with this
release I think the only song on this LP
that I liked was the six minute closer
it was the most ambitious part of this
LP and in my opinion the only moment
that still had that futuristic flair to
it that Thunder cast so fantastically
brought to his debut the song starts off
with some really sweet epic strings
great piano the instrumentation builds
and when Thundercat starts singing he's
sort of forgoes the falsetto and is
singing very nicely on this track and is
delivering some beautifully
commemorative lyrics for for a late
friend easily this track was the most
inspired moment on the album for me
everything else was either something I
didn't like at all or I was just sort of
on the fence with and just really not
feeling anything from whether it be
something positive or negative
unfortunately I mean I'm feeling decent
two strong three on this record if
you've given it a listen what did you
think of it did you love it did you hate
it why what do you think I should review
next and that's it this review is my
opinion if you don't like it here's a
straw I want to give a shout out to John
Tucker tell
Ilana and Rick only the strong subscribe
all mistakes were intentional the needle
drop thundercat apocalypse forever
